channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Zebra crossing light out, 24th November
item.description:
Ever since moving here I never realised the pole in between the crossing was supposed to be a zebra crossing light until I looked up the other night and noticed the white stripes and the lamp that resembled the zebra crossing lights, however the light has never turned on before and as well as this the drivers give no way what so ever so you're always stuck there waiting for ages before you are able to cross which is really inconvenient considering the lamp is right outside of my uni campus.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45-65, Peckham Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Sofa, 24th November
item.description:

item.title: . 3 safety barriers fallen over outside 209 Crofton lane, 24th November
item.description:
. 3 large safety barriwes were placed around a damaged bollard . These have now all fallen over and are completely blocking the pavement and part of the road. This has been like this for several weeks and is a hazard to pedestrians.and cars. Those with pushchairs and wheelchairs can not get round the heap of barriers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on pavement & grass along Southborough Lane & Frankswood Avenue, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Overhanging brunches on public footpath, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Medical Waste Needles And Rubbish In Boxes In Street, 23rd November
item.description:
Medical Waste Needles And Rubbish In Boxes In Street - Danger to children, animals and pedestrians, someone has just dumped a box of rubbish in the street including medical needles and other dangerous waste than needs to be collected immediately. Apologies for the concern but we have many children on school run tomorrow morning and if all of the needles are scattered by others tonight, it will be an impossible mess. Thank you for your help, the person who did this ran off when we came outside and saw what they are doing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6-10, Broadley Street, St. John's Wood, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin overflowing and rubbish scattered around, 23rd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queensway, Petts Wood, Greater London

item.title: Fly-tipping, 23rd November
item.description:
More fly-tipping on Woolwich Road. Can Council put posters with fines for fly-tipping around that road? People need to realise this is not ok to do in the public areas.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich

item.title: Area full of litter - needs frequent sweeping, 23rd November
item.description:
Hi there, Please ensure the roundabout area is cleaned regularly as it sadly accumulates a lot of rubbish as per attached pictures. Best, Lidia

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich

item.title: Fly-tipping on Woolwich Road, 23rd November
item.description:
Hi there, The spots on both sides of Woolwich Road are used as fly-tipping by local residents. Recently, every week something is dumped in there - can you first of all add fly-tipping fine signs in there and of course collect what was abounded over there? Best, Lidia

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
